Key Match Events: In the first T20I, Nicholas Pooran hit Yuzvendra Chahal for a four and a six off three deliveries and Axar Patel for a six and a four in the next over.
Romario Shepherd has a strike rate of 205.88 in the last five overs in T20Is this year, the second-best for any batter to have faced at least 30 deliveries in that phase.
Tilak Varma hit back-to-back sixes during India's run chase after losing both openers early.
India's spinners maintained their plans despite occasional boundaries, and West Indies' seamers used their change of pace effectively to defend their score.
Pre-Game Insights: West Indies wouldn't want to tinker with a winning combination, especially since one more victory would take them close to a series win.
India might play Yashasvi Jaiswal, the only spare batter in the squad, leading to a toss-up between Kuldeep Yadav and Yuzvendra Chahal.
Miscellaneous Highlights: Rain is expected, and two of the last five T20Is at Providence Stadium in Guyana have been washed out.
The scores batting first in the three completed games at Providence Stadium were 146, 157, and 163, with the chasing team winning twice.
